result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse L. Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Each count is concurrent, but consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program and if working for his father he shall be closely monitored to see he is working.   
*  Pay fine of $300   and court costs including all applicable surcharges ea count. 
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided)  and pay surcharge.  
May not have contact with Erica Peltz in any way, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  
*  Make monthly payments for court obligation fees & supervision fees.  Shall not enter any known drug house, nor shall you be present/loitering in any area know for sale or consumption of illegal drugs.  Shall not be around people that use or sell illegal drugs.

09:31 AM All parties appear by zoom.   Deputy District Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State. Probation agent N. Covelli appeared.  Defendant Jesse L. Robinson not in court.  Clerk: HN.  Court finds DE has not made a good faith effort to pay.  Court extends probation 3 months.  Probation agent to prepare order.
Jesse Robinson.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.

Probation review hearing on June 4, 2021 at 09:30 am.  Parties to appear via video conferencing. Instructions to join the hearing are provided with this notice. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. 
Mandatory video appearance is required for Attorneys and parties shall appear by video as able.
Any person entering a courtroom is required to wear a mask.
Public may view this hearing in Kenosha County Courthouse, room 305.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 & 2 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  Each count is concurrent, but Consecutive to any other sentence.  Fined $300 plus costs & surcharges on each count to be paid during probation.  See conditions.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Erica P. in any way unless permitted by the Agent.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
State has no objection to DE's motion in limine with the exception of #6 in 14CM1331.  Upon hearing statements DE is no longer seeking a jury trial and parties have resolved case.  
Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.
Counts 3 & 4 - Dismissed and Read In.
PSI ordered for Sentencing on 8/13/15 at 11:00 AM.
No record made.  Case remains on for status conf. on 6/15/15 at 8:30, trailing 14CM1331.
